definition: to have no time (for sth)/to be too busy (to do sth)
(negative prefix)/not/no
leisure
lit. too much for the eye to take in (idiom); a feast for the eyes
more than one can attend to (idiom)/deluged (with inquiries etc)/overwhelmed (by the beauty of the scenery)
the eye cannot take it all in (idiom); too many good things to see/a feast for the eyes

sentences.english: At the moment I'm a little overwhelmed.
sentences.chinese: 這會兒我真是有點目不暇接了。

sentences.english: Mesmerized by the dazzling magic, they forget their way home.
sentences.chinese: 目不暇給的魔術變換，讓他們忘了回家的路。
來訪者多得讓他應接不暇。

sentences.english: Do not say other, their surrounding changes dizzying.
sentences.chinese: 先不說其它，自己周圍的變化便令人目不暇接了。

sentences.english: The firm has more clients than it can take care of.
sentences.chinese: 這家商行的主顧多得應接不暇。

sentences.english: You do not have to take in new orders.
sentences.chinese: 新的定貨單實在使他們應接不暇了。

sentences.english: He is always too busy to make money to pay back his loans.
sentences.chinese: 爲了儘快還清貸款，他整天忙得席不暇暖。

sentences.english: We were inundated with requests for further information.
sentences.chinese: 要求提供進一步信息的人極多，我們應接不暇。

sentences.english: Three emergency cases came into the hospital at the same time and the doctors really had their hands full.
sentences.chinese: 三個急診病人被同時送到醫院，醫生們真是應接不暇。

sentences.english: France became his first target because at that time France was busy with his own affairs.
sentences.chinese: 由於法國自顧不暇，成爲日本首先欲突破的對象。

sentences.english: He is besieged with visitors from abroad.
sentences.chinese: 海外客人紛至遝來，弄得他應接不暇。

sentences.english: We have been deluged with applications for the job.
sentences.chinese: 申請這個工作的求職信使我們應接不暇。

sentences.english: The season swamps us under wave after wave of produce.
sentences.chinese: 這個季節一波一波的農產品讓我們應接不暇。

sentences.english: They have more business than they can do now.
sentences.chinese: 現在他們的生意是應接不暇。

sentences.english: Example : There is a bewildering variety of software available.
sentences.chinese: 各種可供挑選的軟件使人目不暇接。

sentences.english: As for the Socialists, they appear to be busy fighting each other.
sentences.chinese: 社會黨似乎內部鬥爭激烈，自顧尚且不暇。

definition: to attend to/to deal with
leisure
to have no time to (do sth)
to struggle to cope (with a situation)/to be at one's wits' end
to deal with/to manage/to proceed
the eye is bewildered by five colors (idiom); a dazzling riot of colors
state of affairs
to rush about on errands/to be kept on the run
as for
old variant of 罔[wang3]
none doesn't/there is none who isn't/everyone
variant of 倉促|仓促[cang1 cu4]
dangerous/perilous/to endanger/almost/probably/only
to turn one's head and look around
countless/innumerable
variant of 倉促|仓促[cang1 cu4]
